comparisons.answer1: If XCl ₂ is the chloride, then metal X has valency 2. Therefore: - ● Sulphate formula: XSO ₄ - ● Hydroxide formula: X(OH) ₂
comparisons.answer2: If XCl n then X should be a metal with valency 2 Therefore - (1) Sulphate Formula : XSO n (2) Hydroxide Formula : X(OH) n

comparisons.answer1: If XN is the nitride, metal X has valency 3 (since nitrogen has valency 3). Therefore: i) Sulphate formula: X ₂ (SO ₄ ) ₃ ii) Hydroxide formula: X(OH) ₃ - i)
comparisons.answer2: X n N is nitride. X is a valency 3 metal as nitrogen has valency Therefore Sulphate's formula would be X n (SO n ) n and Hydroxide formula would be X(OH) n

comparisons.answer1: Valency of nitrogen in: i) NO: +2 ii) N ₂ O: +1 iii) NO ₂ : +4 Additional Questions
comparisons.answer2: valency of Nitrogen in: 1) NO : +2 2) N n O : +1 3) NO n : +4

comparisons.answer1: Eight metals showing variable valency: - 1. Iron (Fe): +2, +3 - 2. Copper (Cu): +1, +2 - 3. Mercury (Hg): +1, +2 - 4. Tin (Sn): +2, +4 - 5. Lead (Pb): +2, +4 - 6. Gold (Au): +1, +3 - 7. Chromium (Cr): +2, +3, +6 - 8. Manganese (Mn): +2, +3, +4, +6, +7 Valency of sulphur in: a) SO ₂ : +4 b) SO ₃ : +6
comparisons.answer2: The eight metals showing variable valency 1) Iron (Fe) : +2, +3 (2) Copper (Cu) : +1, +2 (3) Mercury (Hg) : +1, +2 (4) Tin (Sn) : +2, +4 (5) Lead (Pb) : +2, +4 (6) Gold (Au) : +1, +3 (7) Chromium (Cr) : +2, +3, +6 (8) Manganese (Mn) : +2, +3, +4, +6, +7

comparisons.answer1: Examples of chemical equations: a) One product: 2H ₂ + O ₂ → 2H ₂ O b) Two products: CaCO ₃ → CaO + CO ₂ c) Three products: 4HNO ₃ → 2H ₂ O + 4NO ₂ + O ₂ d) Four products: 2KClO ₃ → 2KCl + 2O ₂ + O ₂ + Heat
comparisons.answer2: Examples of Chemical Equations: ## Page 2 (a) One product : 2H2 + O2 ﬁ 2H2O - (b) Two Products : CaCO3 (b) Two Products : CaCO3 ﬁ CaO + CO2 + (c) Three Products : 4HNO3 ﬁ 2H2O + 4NO2 + O2 - (d) Four Products : 2KClO3 (d) Four Products : 2KClO3 ﬁ 2KCl + 2O2 + O2 › + D
